item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Wednesday, September 4, 2024 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Firefox will consider a Rust implementation of JPEG-XL (57 points | 13 comments)
2. Exploring Goja: A Golang JavaScript Runtime (12 points | 10 comments)
3. LSP: the good, the bad, and the ugly (36 points | 23 comments)
4. Swift creator Chris Lattner on Mojo & Roc (40 points | 17 comments)

6. Beyond Ctrl-C: The dark corners of Unix signal handling (14 points | 21 comments)
7. It's not Rust, it's FreeBSD (and LLVM) (41 points | 20 comments)
8. retronews: TUI browser for HN and Lobsters emulating classical Usenet and mail readers (52 points | 13 comments)
9. Whither the Apple AGX graphics driver? (8 points | 1 comment)
10. Avoiding Test-Case Permutation Blowout (4 points | 7 comments)
11. YubiKey Security Advisory YSA-2024-03 (31 points | 18 comments)
12. Things I Wished More Developers Knew About Databases (10 points | no comments)
13. What Humanities Scholars Want Students To Know About the Internet: Alternative Paths for Alternative Endpoints (9 points | no comments)
14. Async Rust can be a pleasure to work with (without `Send + Sync + 'static`) (2 points | no comments)
15. Expat 2.6.3 released, includes security fixes (3 points | no comments)
16. Creating a Git commit: The Hard Way (1 points | no comments)
17. Greppability is an underrated code metric (51 points | 29 comments)
18. In practice, abstractions hide their underlying details (6 points | 7 comments)
19. Programming the Convergent WorkSlate's spreadsheet microcassette future (1 points | no comments)
20. Yubikey is the Digital Seat Belt We Need Today (19 points | 30 comments)
21. "SRE" doesn't seem to mean anything useful any more (9 points | 6 comments)
22. A TUI for sniffing network traffic using eBPF on Linux (13 points | 2 comments)
23. tetris-sql: Using SQL's Turing Completeness to Build Tetris (1 points | no comments)
24. Setting up a cache server for apt packages (23 points | 9 comments)
25. Interactive NixOS tests (5 points | no comments)
